newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: LG Group plans local industrial complex.
newsitem.headline: LG Group plans local industrial complex.

text.p: South Korea's third largest conglomerate, the LG Group, plans to invest 1.53 trillion won by the year 2002 in building an industrial complex, a group spokesman said on Friday.
The complex in the southwestern city of Kunsan will house garment, metal and electronics products plants and will produce 2.2 trillion won worth of goods annually, he said.
From 1999 to 2001, LG Electronics plans to spend 631.9 billion won on the electronics goods plant.
LG International plans to spend 367.3 billion won on the garment factory from the year 2002 for completion by 2004. The remining sum will be invested by LG Metals.
The spokesman said the complex would employ about 10,000 workers.
